Title: Group partners TotalEnergies Foundation on safe mobility
Summary: TotalEnergies, in collaboration with the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited (NNPCL), has officially launched the 2025 VIA Programme for Safe Mobility in Nigeria .

Title: Dangote slashes petrol price as independent  marketers undercut price
Summary: Dangote Petroleum Refinery has announced a further reduction in the pump price of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS) Retail prices now range from N875 per litre in Lagos to N905 in other parts of the country .

Title: Demand for concrete roads amid cement shortfall: Matters arising
Summary: Growing preference for concrete roads across Nigeria signals a positive shift in the country’s infrastructure development strategy . Federal government spearheading that preference .

Title: Three convicted of Internet fraud sentenced to 90 months imprisonment
Summary: A Federal High Court and a Rivers State High Court in Port Harcourt have convicted and sentenced three Internet fraudsters to a total of 90 months imprisonment for impersonation and obtaining money under false pretences .

Title: ECOWAS Parliament bars members from insulting leaders
Summary: ECOWAS Parliament bars members from insulting leaders . The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) Parliament has adopted new Rules of Procedure . The rules prohibit members from making derogatory remarks about fellow members and heads of state .

Title: CBN rolls out baseline standards for  Anti-Money Laundering solutions
Summary: The CBN has rolled out a draft ‘Baseline Standards for Automated Anti Money Laundering’, AML, solutions . CBN is in a bid to encourage financial institutions’ adoption of emerging technologies that enhances detection and reporting of suspicious transactions in real time .

Title: Dangote Refinery slashes petrol price by N15 per litre
Summary: Dangote Refinery has slashed the pump price of premium motor spirit (PMS), also known as petrol, by N15 per litre . Nigerians can now purchase the product at N875 per litre in Lagos instead of N890; N885; N885; N875 in Lagos .

Title: Nigeria’s foreign trade in LC rises 4%  to $269.83m
Summary: Nigeria’s foreign trade through Letters of Credit grew by 4.4 percent year-on-year, YoY, to $269.83 million in the first four months of 2025 . LC is a bank document guarantying payment for imports .

Title: Customs foils N3bn drug smuggling attempt at Apapa Port
Summary: Apapa Area Command intercepted a shipment of prohibited pharmaceuticals and other contraband goods with an estimated duty paid value (DPV) of N3.2 billion . The shipment smuggled into the country through the Lagos Port Complex, was uncovered following an enforcement operations, while three suspects have been arrested .

Title: Slain WAEC student: Key witness testimony delays full report —Police
Summary: Kehinde Alade was tragically shot by a stray bullet fired by a police officer . Oyo State Police Command said absence of testimony from a key witness in the killing of 14-year-old is delaying the completion of its comprehensive report .

Title: I'm expecting more defections to APC - Tinubu
Summary: President Bola Tinubu said he was expecting more politicians to defect to the ruling All Progressives Congress ahead of the 2027 general elections . The President spoke at the APC Renewed Hope Agenda Summit, held at the State House Conference Centre on Thursday . He said he did not expect people to remain in “a sinking ship

Title: NNPCL empowers 531 corps members with grants, starter packs
Summary: The NNPC has given N531,000 each to 531 NYSC members in a bid to make them self-reliant . The items were presented to the corps members by the Group Chief Executive Officer of N.NPC Ltd. in Abuja .

Title: UNILAG denies delay in NELFund loan refunds to students
Summary: The institution’s Head of Communication Unit, Mrs Adejoke Alaga-Ibraheem, debunked the report in a statement on Thursday . She assured all that refunds would be processed according to regulations . The university management remains committed to its core values of transparency, accountability and student-centred service delivery .

Title: Five arrested for diverting Kebbi’s N184m agrochemicals
Summary: Operatives of the Kebbi State Police Command have arrested five suspects in connection with the criminal diversion and sale of agrochemical products worth over N184m . The suspects were arrested following a swift operation by detectives from the State Criminal Investigation Department . The case involves multiple charges including criminal conspiracy, theft, receiving stolen property, and money

Title: Tight security as court declines to stop Owa Obokun’s coronation
Summary: An Osun State High Court has refused to stop the coronation of the new Owa Obokun of Ijesaland, Oba Clement Haastrup, scheduled to be held today (Friday) Justice M. Agboola, at Thursday’s proceedings on the case filed by the Arimoro family of
